dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 5699 RH: John Muir National Historic Site Expansion Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. George Miller of California introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic
For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on November 13, 2014

form.official-title: To authorize the Secretary of the Interior to acquire approximately 44 acres of land in Martinez, California, and for other purposes.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
John Muir National Historic Site Expansion Act
.

section.header: John Muir National Historic Site land acquisition

subsection.text: The Secretary of the Interior may acquire by donation the approximately 44 acres of land, and interests in such land, that are identified on the map entitled John Muir National Historic Site Proposed Boundary Expansion, numbered 426/127150, and dated November, 2014.

Upon the acquisition of the land authorized by subsection (a), the Secretary of the Interior shall adjust the boundaries of the John Muir Historic Site in Martinez, California, to include the land identified on the map referred to in subsection (a).

The land and interests in land acquired under subsection (a) shall be administered as part of the John Muir National Historic Site established by the Act of August 31, 1964 ( Public Law 88–547 ; 78 Stat. 753;
16 U.S.C. 461 note).

The authority provided in subsections (a), (b), and (c) shall apply only if the lands identified on the map entitled John Muir National Historic Site Proposed Boundary Expansion are held in title by the Muir Heritage Land Trust by May 31, 2015.

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
